I`m Melanie, a quantitative ecologist at [Aarhus University](https://pure.au.dk/portal/en/persons/melanie-tietje(6abaa223-a82b-4577-acce-f2ead58ba86b).html) interested in all sorts of macroecological patterns. I am currently part of the [TropiToL project](https://peb-group.net/trf) in which we are exploring large-scale biodiversity patterns in plants by combining geographic, phylogenetic and environmental data. 

I have worked on deep time paleontological as well as neontological topics, extinction risk influencing factors in invertebrates and amphibians, geographic range size patterns, diversity, the combination of climatic with biological data, and recently phylogenies.
